results.definition: an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered
examples: send me an account of what I owe

results.definition: a record or narrative description of past events
examples: he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president
don't do it on my account
the paper was rejected on account of its length

results.definition: to give an account or representation of in words
a statement of recent transactions and the resulting balance
examples: they send me an accounting every month

results.definition: the act of informing by verbal report
examples: by all accounts they were a happy couple

results.definition: a formal contractual relationship established to provide for regular banking or brokerage or business services
examples: he asked to see the executive who handled his account

results.definition: a statement that makes something comprehensible by describing the relevant structure or operation or circumstances etc.
a short account of the news
examples: the account of his speech that was given on the evening news made the governor furious

results.definition: furnish a justifying analysis or explanation
examples: I can't account for the missing money

results.definition: be the sole or primary factor in the existence, acquisition, supply, or disposal of something
examples: Passing grades account for half of the grades given in this exam
he predicted that although it is of small account now it will rapidly increase in importance
she turned her writing skills to good account
